reviewText: Okay us loyal fans of Third Watch need to get on the ball and email NBC and bug as many people as we can to get this great show released on DVD.  I see all of these other subpar shows that have barely been on a year released to box sets and it angers me!  Lets speak out people! This show never got the recognition it deserved, it was never nominated for any awards and when it was canceled the network didnt make any fuss what-so-ever about it.  So we weren't able to save the show but lets help it live on.  I think this was the best show on Television with an outstanding ensamble cast, it will be greatly missed!

reviewText: There is not enough good solid drama on TV anymore, so I started checking out past-solid shows via rerun on cable.  I found Third Watch, got immediately sucked in and I am now a fan.  I just watched another solid show with a great, true to life cast, and man (!) I just have to get the complete set.  Not since HOMICIDE:LIFE ON THE STREET, has there been such a gutty, true to life show that lets us see inside the minds of today's true crime fighters.  Someone call NBC and let's get the entire set out ASAP.  A salute to all of the staff for having such a real show, even if it is on cable.........
summary: Third Watch Is Part of My TV Life

reviewText: As I have got Older, the TV programmes that I have gotten engrossed in, are few & far between. I watched the first few episodes of' 24' but soon tired of it, never bothered with 'Lost'. And because I haven't got satellite, I have missed 'Heroes' and other so-called 'must-see' TV. Third Watch was different. Firstly I never made an effort to watch it. I came across it by accident, flicking the channels one work day afternoon. I enjoyed what I had seen, and checked the schedules to see when it was next on. For the next few months, even through Channel 4, here in the UK, chopped & changed the times, I stayed with it, only missing a couple of episodes. When my sister, who lives in New York, mentioned that it had been cancelled, I was determined to get the DVD collection, which i did via amazon.co.uk. This first season collection is purely Old skool. No extras, just the 20 odd episodes that make up the first season. What are the attractions of this series? Well like any drama, well written, believable characters, great story lines, and like life, different personalities (Macho Boscho is a favourite) I await series two with bated breath
Title: N/A

reviewText: To have this series released on DVD - to me, this series is much better than "E.R."  I've been a faithful fan since the very first episode in 1999 and it just keeps getting better.  The different personalities of the characters in this changing ensemble cast seems to work rather well.  You've got Sully, the veteran patrol cop, who is teamed up with young pup Davis (the son of his slain partner)  Then, you have Yokas (who's trying her best to do triple duty as officer/wife and mother)paired up with Bosco (who never seems to know when to quit, much less when to keep his mouth shut or his ego in check.)  Add to it your paramedics and firefighters:  Doc (who seemed to make his work his life and ended up burned out,) Carlos (who seems to never change his self-centered personality,) Kim (who's on again/off again relationship with ex-hubby Jimmy Doherty gives plenty to talk about.)  They're all out there, working the 3-12 shift and trying to do the right thing, on duty and off.  Some of the cast members have come and gone throughtout the first 5 seasons, but it still remains a well-written show, as well as one that keeps viewers on the edge of their seats.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I simply can't BELIEVE the total CRAP they leave on TV and cancel the BEST shows.  Who the H**L does the ratings on these shows?  They sure aren't checking with the viewing public!  THIRD WATCH was one of the best shows on the network.  I've never seen a bad review on it.  The show was real; the characters played their roles so true to the heart.  Being in EMS myself, this was the closest to true life I've ever seen on TV.  The show portrayed things that go on in the field very realistically.  It isn't always a happy ending in real life either.  The things these characters were going through were genuinely portrayed.  Good cops and not so good cops... mistakes in the field happen.  Paramedics, police, hospital workers and firefighters dealing with personal problems while on duty, being torn in different directions is truly a constant battle.  What is the point in getting a good show on the air and then slap the actors and your viewing public in the face by cancelling it?  Someone's seriously lying if they said they did a survey and found no one was watching it.  The Nielson Ratings system is total fraud and a joke.  And why is it that you can't even get the third season that was filmed to show on the air?  Does someone in upper management of the network have something against this show?  You can't even get it in DVD.  God knows, they've already got the first 3 seasons of 24 out and they're in their 4th season.  You can get anything else in the world on DVD but not THIRD WATCH.  Come on "networks", get rid of whoever has something against this show, get the third season back on the air and at LEAST let "YOUR VIEWING PUBLIC" have the first 2 seasons on DVD.  We deserve better treatment than this for keeping you in business to begin with!
summary: BRING BACK THIRD WATCH, ALSO GIVE IT TO US IN DVD PLEASE!!!!

reviewText: This series is better than 99% of the TV and feature films produced today, yet it has been largely ignored by the literate reviewers and hosts who rave over profane tripe like Deadwood and History of Violence. Why?  Third Watch is about flawed, yet decent people who try to overcome their weaknesses and fears to do the right thing. It's a positive view of life.It reveres love, life and decency while portraying the world as it is, gritty realism and all. And it does it without four letter words. It's this positive view of life that offends the literati, who seem to be stalled in their maturation at the middle school level.It may be years until the dinosaurs at the studios release this series. Why wait? A loophole in the new copyright law makes it legally available for purchase now. Google Third Watch DVD buy and find the best DVD entertainment site to buy it on 34 disks. It's the best series I ever watched.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Third Watch was an excellent show. My wife and I watched the first season in about 3 days. There's not a dull episode in the entire run of the show. Police/Firefighters and Paramedics on their daily job saving lives and facing danger and possible death. This is entertainment. Future episodes get even better..hope they continue until their all released. My favorite is Molly Price as Faith Yokas. She's tuff but I just love her. Bosco and Doc are my next favorites. I love Bobby too (wish he was on the show longer). If you've never seen this show...A & E runs it weekday mornings 700-800 eastern time. I highly reccommend this show !
summary: One of the best shows EVER !

reviewText: Delays in getting shows like Third Watch to market on DVD are what are driving the whole video swap movement- we have a global community and there is no need to hold back on programs! Sell dvds in one platform that play everywhere and release them in a timely fashion- make the price reflect the licensing required. Third Watch is one that confounds me along with Crossing Jordan. My other 90s favorite missing in the US is Ally McBeal which I intend to pick up a full box set R2 disks next trip to the UK! I have the $40 Coby region free player- just need the disks.Ally I can at least understand- the whole music licensing is behind the delay here. 2nd season of Quantum Leap was ruined when NBC substituted key music to avoid licensing fees....The whole 2 sided disk thing sucks- I can never tell which side is which- please release shows on single sided DVDs!Nuff of a rant for now:)

reviewText: I just started watching Third Watch on A&E; in the last couple of months.  It is fantastic!  The characters are perfect for their parts.  This isn't one of those shows that you can predict what is going to happen, it almost always surprises you.  Unfortunately I found out my favorite characted dies later on. I am only up to the 2000 season.  Bosco is the man!!!!!  He was a lot like me when I was a firefighter.  Who knows, maybe the show might not worth be watching once I see him gone.I surely hope a DVD comes out soon.  The only other show that has me this excited is The Shield.  It would be a toss up to which one is my favorite show.  T

reviewText: Good personalities are just as important to the worth of a show or movie as good writing.  This show has plenty of good personalities.  I will definitely buy every season of the show.  The story line deals with evening shift police and paramedics.  The show deals less with the solving of crimes and rescuing people and more about the characters themselves.  There is enough action to keep the show from being a soap opera, but enough personal matters about the characters to make them more like the people next door.
